articles.title: Bahrain says it foiled planned attack, arrests suspects
articles.description: Interior ministry says it has confiscated weapons and explosives, arrested people for 'plotting terrorist operations'.
articles.content:
Bahrain security forces have arrested a number of suspects, and confiscated weapons and explosives ahead of a planned attack, the interior ministry said.
The ministry did not say how many people wer… [+1200 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Blast hits mosque in Afghanistan’s Nangarhar province: Reports
articles.description: An unnamed Taliban official told AFP new agency that the blast in the Spin Ghar area caused fatalities and injuries.
articles.content:
An explosion has hit a mosque in the Spin Ghar area of Nangarhar province in eastern Afghanistan during Friday prayers, wounding at least 12 people, a residents and a Taliban official have said.

articles.title: At least three killed as explosions rock Uganda’s capital
articles.description: Blasts cause chaos in Kampala as terrified residents flee the city's centre.
articles.content:
At least three people have been killed and dozens of others wounded after two explosions rocked Ugandas capital, Kampala, in what police described as a coordinated attack.

articles.title: Yemeni journalist and child killed in car bombing in Aden
articles.description: Explosion took place in Aden when Rasha Abdullah al-Harazi and her family were heading to a doctor, officials say.
articles.content: A Yemeni journalist and her child have been killed in a car bombing that targeted her familys vehicle in Yemens southern city of Aden, officials said. The blast was the latest to rock the seat of the… [+3120 chars]

articles.title: Mustafa al-Kadhimi: Iraq's PM survives 'assassination bid'
articles.description: Military says Mustafa al-Kadhimi escaped unhurt after a drone laden with explosives targeted his residence in Baghdad.
articles.content:
Iraqs military says Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi survived an assassination attempt after a drone laden with explosives targeted his residence in the capital, Baghdad.
